title: 110_s2455
content:
The "Community Foreclosure Assistance Act of 2007" may be cited as the short title. Additional emergency CDBG funding is addressed in the Act. The "Community Foreclosure Assistance Act of 2007" authorizes $1 billion for housing foreclosure impact assistance and rental aid for individual renters. Counseling services are the only exception for fund use. The "Community Foreclosure Assistance Act of 2007" authorizes $1 billion for housing foreclosure impact assistance and rental aid for individual renters. Funds cannot be given directly to homeowners for foreclosure prevention purposes, except for counseling services. Certified housing counseling services approved by HUD can receive the funds as subrecipients. SEC. 3. INCREASED PUBLIC SERVICES REQUIREMENT CAP.

    The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to increase the requirement for public services funding to 25 percent.

SEC. 4. LOW AND MODERATE INCOME REQUIREMENT.

    At least 50 percent of the funds under this Act must benefit low- and moderate-income individuals.

SEC. 5. PLANS AND REPORTS. SEC. 5. PLANS AND REPORTS.

    States, metropolitan cities, or urban counties must submit a comprehensive plan for fund usage approval. Quarterly reports on fund expenditure are required. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development can waive certain provisions of statutes or regulations to facilitate the use of funds by States, metropolitan cities, or urban counties, excluding fair housing, nondiscrimination, labor standards, and environmental requirements. Waivers must align with the overall purpose of the statute. Additionally, the Secretary may waive the 50 percent requirement upon request. The Housing and Urban Development Secretary can waive the 50 percent requirement and public service cap upon request from States, metropolitan cities, or urban counties if a compelling need is demonstrated. Any waiver authorized under this section must be published in the Federal Register at least 5 days before taking effect. The Housing and Urban Development Secretary must register any waiver of statutes or regulations at least 5 days before it takes effect. Each waiver granted must be reviewed and reauthorized by the Secretary within 2 years. The Secretary must also notify the Senate and House Committees on Appropriations of any waivers granted or denied at least 5 days before the decision is made. SEC. 7. Noncompliance with community development requirements under this Act will be subject to the provisions of section 111 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974. SEC. 8. The Comptroller General will conduct an audit of all funds appropriated under this Act and submit a report to the Senate and House Committees. SEC. 9. Reports will be required as part of the oversight process. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must report quarterly to the Senate and House Committees on the use of funds, including counseling and rental assistance details, certified housing counseling services, and steps taken to prevent fraud and abuse.
